intro: Prestoea simplicifrons, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptical in shape. It typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The bark is smooth and grayish, and the plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
